result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph Kue

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Further proceedings on August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

2:01 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jill L. Vendetti appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joseph Kue appeared by video.  Attorney Nathan J. Heim appeared by video for Joseph Kue. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for trial. Inducement contained in 06-27-22 letter.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed. Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Further proceedings scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

2:36 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joseph Kue in court.  Attorney Ann Larson in court for Joseph Kue. Defendant demands a preliminary hearing. Preliminary hearing is set for 07-06-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 3.
Preliminary hearing on July 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Initial appearance is reset to 06-20-22 at 1:30 p.m. to allow public defender to appoint counsel.   
Minutes.
Re:  Possess THC, 2nd & subsequent offense, on 04-23-22.
Order to report to MTPD for photo and prints

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of possess marijuana, repeater and possess drug paraphernalia.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 05-16-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1.500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
